performance.translation[0].definitions[0: when someone performs a play or a piece of music
This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
Their performance of Mozart’s Concerto in E flat was finely controlled and dramatic.
performance.translation[0].definitions[1: how well or badly a person, company etc does a particular job or activity
Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
I was impressed by the team’s performance.
The country’s economic performance so far this year has been good.
Shareholders blamed him for the company’s poor performance.
her disappointing performance in the Olympics
Exam results are used as performance indicators  (=things that show how well something is done) for schools.
performance.translation[0].definitions[2: the act of doing a piece of work, duty etc
the performance of his official duties
performance.translation[0].definitions[3: how well a car or other machine works
The car’s performance on mountain roads was impressive.
an imaging system using high-performance (=very effective) technology
performance.translation[0].note_box[0].s: give a performance
Samuel Jackson gives a terrific performance as Elijah.
turn in/deliver a performance
Both actors turn in great performances.
In the role of Carmen, Ms Leblanc delivered a quite exquisite performance.
go to a performance
We can go to the evening performance if you prefer.
The Princess attended a performance of The Magic Flute at the London Coliseum.
a fine/great performance
There are fine performances by Kathy Bates and Daryl Hannah.
a memorable performance

a brilliant/magnificent/superb performance
Rogers gave a brilliant performance of Chopin’s Piano Concerto No. 1.
a virtuoso performance
He delivered a virtuoso performance as The Phantom Of The Opera.
a live performance
This is the band’s first live performance since last year.
a solo performance
Young’s solo performances are often his most effective.

disappointing

lacklustre

economic performance

financial performance

improve somebody’s performance

produce a performance

performance targets

performance.translation[1].definitions[0: the degree to which a company, investment, financial market etc is profitable
The company is showing strong performance and doing considerably better than the retail industry as a whole.
They will report a $500 million loss, one of the worst performances ever by a US brokerage firm.
performance.translation[1].definitions[1: how well a machine, vehicle etc works
Consumers believed the car’s price was relatively expensive for its performance.
performance.translation[1].definitions[2: the way that someone does their job, and how well they do it
Some people were critical of her performance as a manager.
performance.translation[1].definitions[3: the act of doing the things mentioned in a contract in the way that they should be done
the seller’s performance of his part of the contract
